Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[A11y] Search page a11y fixes for tags and framework filter buttons" (#9429) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9402, https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9412 and https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9413 This PR fixes 3 a11y issues: 1. The tags in search results sometimes appeared on the same line as the other package metadata (version, last created, etc.) and sometimes appeared on the next line. We wanted to make this consistent and always have the 'tags' on the next line, but adding a `
` element in the middle of a list led to this a11y issue: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/225134180-860cebea-4b3e-46a4-bb2d-9eece8107921.png) I've now removed the `
` element and fixed this with some css: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/225132168-62bffd76-acd6-4460-8b58-a549e1a4ee0f.png) 2. The chevrons that expanded/collapsed the TFM sections in the Filters panel did not indicate their expanded/collapsed state. The screen reader should be able to read their state. The 'aria-expanded' can be used to fix this. 3. These chevrons also all had the same 'aria-label': "shows and hides TFM filters". I've now made each button's label relevant to its specific frameworks: eg. "shows and hides TFM filters for .NET Standard".

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Update the issue template list to talk about sign in issues" (#9432) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "Cannot get packageHash through API v3" (#9433) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

NuGet SDK

### Product Version

6.0.400

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

There is no option to collect the packageHash of a NuGet in the API V3 short of:

1. Doing a registration call followed by catalog call (which is a slow thing)
`https://api.nuget.org/v3/registration5-gz-semver2/newtonsoft.json/12.0.3.json` then `https://api.nuget.org/v3/catalog0/data/2022.12.08.16.43.03/newtonsoft.json.12.0.3.json`

2. Calling the (deprecated) V2 XML api instead as in `https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/Packages(Id='newtonsoft.json',Version='12.0.3')`. This does provide the full details including packageHash in a single call.

As a result the only available options to collect a hash (in order to make an important nupkg integrity verification) are either slow or deprecated.

Note that the same is true when using the SDK and making calls to the NuGet Client libraries.

Please add the package hash to the v3 API 


### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: Cannot sign-in" (#9431) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

I'm unable to use NuGet.org

### Describe the bug

My username is bwakabats

My email address is **REDACTED** (I do not have access to this email anymore but can sign-in to it using MS)

My new email address is **REDACTED**

I cannot sign-in to my **REDACTED** account

### Repro Steps

When I sign in as **REDACTED** (using MS) it says "The account with the email **REDACTED** is linked to another Microsoft account."

When I sign in to as **REDACTED** (using MS) I am told "Looks like we don't have an account with this email address (**REDACTED**) in our records." and asks me to sign-up, but I cant use the username "**REDACTED**" because its already taken.

When using the "Need assistance signing in" link, I enter the username "**REDACTED**" and the email address "**REDACTED**" and get an email saying "Our records indicate the associated Microsoft login(s): **REDACTED** **REDACTED**."

### Expected Behavior

I sign-in to my **REDACTED** account using one of the email addresses

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Stop building NuGet.Packaging.Core" (#12495) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Affected

dotnet.exe, NuGet SDK

### Current Behavior

A long time ago, NuGet.Packaging.Core was merged into NuGet.Packaging. 

We added type forwarders to allow certain pre-built tasks from arcade to still work. 

We might need to ensure that the .NET SDK can build correct without NuGet.Packaging.Core first before removing it.

### Desired Behavior

NuGet.Packaging.Core is redudant.

### Additional Context

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet detecting non-existent cycle in solution" (#12494) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

MSBuild.exe

### Product Version

MSBuild version 17.6.0-preview-23122-03+f93b24b5a for .NET Framework

### Worked before?

Yes, on the same version. The issue goes away and pops back up randomly

### Impact

I'm unable to use this version

### Repro Steps & Context

The issue happens intermittently. The code is internal, so you can reach out to me for the complete sln.

This is one of the project files `PreBind.csproj` in the solution:

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">
  <PropertyGroup>
    <Configuration Condition=" '$(Configuration)' == '' ">Debug</Configuration>
    <Platform Condition=" '$(Platform)' == '' ">x86</Platform>
    <TargetFramework>net472</TargetFramework>
    <GenerateAssemblyInfo>false</GenerateAssemblyInfo>
    <Platforms>AnyCPU;x86</Platforms>
  </PropertyGroup>
  <ItemDefinitionGroup>
    <PackageReference GeneratePathProperty="true" />
  </ItemDefinitionGroup>
  <ItemGroup>
    <PackageReference Include="VS.Tools.DevDiv.Decatur" Version="17.5.22121502" PrivateAssets="all" ExcludeAssets="all" />
  </ItemGroup>
  <ItemGroup>
    <Reference Include="$(PkgVS_Tools_DevDiv_Decatur)\Microsoft.Cabinet.dll" />
    <Reference Include="$(PkgVS_Tools_DevDiv_Decatur)\Microsoft.WindowsInstaller.dll" />
    <Reference Include="$(PkgVS_Tools_DevDiv_Decatur)\Sign.dll" />
    <Reference Include="$(PkgVS_Tools_DevDiv_Decatur)\UnifiedBuildInterface.dll" />
    <Reference Include="$(PkgVS_Tools_DevDiv_Decatur)\wix.dll" />
    <Reference Include="$(PkgVS_Tools_DevDiv_Decatur)\WixVSExtension.dll" />
    <Reference Include="$(PkgVS_Tools_DevDiv_Decatur)\wconsole.dll" />
  </ItemGroup>
  <ItemGroup>
    <ProjectReference Include="$(MSBuildThisFileDirectory)..\Prebind\Prebind.csproj" />
    <ProjectReference Include="$(MSBuildThisFileDirectory)..\BuildTools\BuildTools.csproj" />
  </ItemGroup>
</Project>
```

When I try to build I keep getting errors like:

```
6>C:\Users\yobae\source\repos\SetupBuild2\IronmanExpParser\IronmanExpParser.csproj : error NU1108: Cycle detected. 
6>C:\Users\yobae\source\repos\SetupBuild2\IronmanExpParser\IronmanExpParser.csproj : error NU1108:   IronManExpParser -> PreBind -> PreBind.
```

Which seems to suggest PreBind has a dependency on itself.

[detailed.log](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/11004771/detailed.log)

### Verbose Logs

```shell
Attached detailed log above.
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "dotnet restore behavior change from 6.0.404 to 6.0.405 in Linux" (#12431) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe

### Product Version

dotnet SDK 6.0.405

### Worked before?

dotnet SDK 6.0.404

### Impact

I'm unable to use this version

### Repro Steps & Context

Describe the bug
dotnet SDK 6.0.405 will fail the build if the NuGet feed specified in NuGet.config cannot be reached.
The same version on Windows does not experience this behavior.
Older versions of Linux SDK also do not experience this behavior

To Reproduce
Create a new C# project without any PackageReferences
Create NuGet.config with an unreachable feed
Pin dotnet SDK to 6.0.405
Execute dotnet build
Expected:
5. Successful build

Exceptions (if any)
error NU1301: Unable to load the service index for source ...
Failed to restore *csproj

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "I could run VS Code attached to a container using F5, but now I can't" (#12432) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Affected

NuGet.exe, dotnet.exe

### Current Behavior

This is what we do:

- We run a container that is customized from `mcr.microsoft.com/vscode/devcontainers/dotnet:7.0-bullseye-slim` and has once ran `dotnet restore` to cache all of the dependencies.
- Then we attach to it using `ms-vscode-remote.remote-containers`
- Then we hit <kbd>F5</kbd> to run it in debug mode
- Then we see that it actually tries to restore everything, and in the end, it gives us this error:

```
error : Unable to obtain lock file access on '/tmp/NuGetScratch/lock' for operations on '/home/user/test/NuGet.Config'. This may mean that a different user or administrator is holding this lock and that this process does not have permission to access it. If no other process is currently performing an operation on this file it may mean that an earlier NuGet process crashed and left an inaccessible lock file, in this case removing the file '/tmp/NuGetScratch/lock' will allow NuGet to continue.
```



### Desired Behavior

I don't know what is changed. NuGet? VS Code? Dev Containers? I have no idea. But before recent changes this was our procedure:

- We would run a container (that has ran `dotnet restore` once)
- We could attach to it
- We would hit <kbd>F5</kbd> and withing 500ms it would restore and run our code in debug mode

### Additional Context

Something stupid is changed here. I know that I should be polite. But you cause us so much pain that I should tell you how much I hate your decisions. Let us run everything as root.

I don't care if it's dangerous or not. I still choose it. I take the risks. But you don't let us do that.

Once inside the container, I want everything to be root.

We do all of these steps:

- setting `NUGET_SCRATCH=/Temp/NuGet`
- setting `NUGET_ConcurrencyUtils_DeleteOnClose=1`
- `sudo rm -rf obj`
- `sudo rm -rf bin`
- `sudo chown -R vscode:vscode /Temp/NuGet`
- `sudo chmod -R 777 /Temp/NuGet`

But when we hit <kbd>F5</kbd> we still see that it tries to restore everything and sometimes it works and sometimes it complains about that lock error.

Please, let us choose to run everything in the highest privilege everywhere. Give us options to run everything as root. Let us configure NuGet and dotnet and VS Code and every f***king thing to run as root.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "GlobalPackageReference is not working for legacy-style csproj projects" (#12368) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

VS 17.4.4

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

1. Create a solution with both a SDK-style csproj file and a legacy-style csproj file (e.g. .NET Framework project).
2. Add a NuGet package to both.
3. Enable Central Package Management per [documentation](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/consume-packages/Central-Package-Management#).
4. Note that Central Package Management works fine for both project types.
5. Add a Global Package Reference (per [documentation](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/consume-packages/Central-Package-Management#global-package-references)) to the `Directory.Packages.props` file, e.g. [PolySharp](https://www.nuget.org/packages/PolySharp/).
6. Note that the global package reference works in the SDK-style project but is **not** working in the legacy-style project.

`<PackageReference>` and the base feature of Central Package Management both work with legacy-style csproj files, so why doesn't `<GlobalPackageReference>` work too?

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug Bash] The alternative package “ErikEJ.EntityFramework.SqlServerCompact” cannot be found through clicking the link in deprecated package info  " (#12492) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

NuGet Client Dev\6.6.0.52

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

#### Repro Steps:     

1. Create a C# Class Library (.NET Framework) project.   

2. Right-click the project in Solution Explorer and select "Manage NuGet Packages…" menu item to open PM UI.   

3. Select the package source: “nuget.org” near the gear button and go to "Browse" tab. 

4. Search for a deprecated package “EntityFramework.SqlServerCompact.PrivateDeployment” in "Browse" tab.  

5. Click the link “ErikEJ.EntityFramework.SqlServerCompact” in the description of the package in the searched package list or the link “ErikEJ.EntityFramework.SqlServerCompact” on the right panel.  

#### Expected:     

The alternative package “ErikEJ.EntityFramework.SqlServerCompact” is showing in the searched package list.  

#### Actual:     

The alternative package “ErikEJ.EntityFramework.SqlServerCompact” cannot be found as below screenshot. 

![MicrosoftTeams-image (1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/84695155/225867519-81b8dad0-af5a-43f1-925c-59de55953556.png)

  

#### Notes:  

1.The repro rate is 100%.  
2.It is not a regression since it doesn't repro on VS Main\33005.16 + NuGet Client Dev\6.4.0.107.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Moving to the new .NET Foundation CLA service" (#68) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
Hello everyone
The .NET Foundation is transitioning to a new CLA service and I'm posting here to let you know it's happening. Some background info:

The new CLA service is based off of https://github.com/microsoft/ContributorLicenseAgreement, except it uses the dotnet-policy-service app

- Current contributors do not need to sign the CLA again
- The CLA agreement itself is not changing
- As part of the install/configuration process, the following work items will be completed

1. Create a .github repo if it doesn't exist already
2. Install the dotnet-policy-service app
3. Create PRs for the platformcontext.xml and cla.yml files
4. Disable the existing CLA webhook
5. Push the PRs to enable the new CLA service

That's all there is to it. I'll update this issue once the work is complete

Thanks
Chris
.NET Foundation Operations team

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet.org migration towards a new multi-CDN infrastructure" (#60) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
In the coming weeks, nuget.org will be migrating towards a new multi-CDN infrastructure that will improve the experience of our users. This change allows our team flexibility to switch to a back-up provider in the case that one CDN is down, which will broaden coverage for our users.

Some changes are coming for older TLS cipher suites, which may result in connectivity issues. From our data we believe this will affect only a small percentage of requests. We will be monitoring all feedback channels during the migration to assess impact and adjust our roll-out timeline as needed.

Below, we provide resources to determine whether you will be affected by this change. This utilizes the [.NET CLI](https://dotnet.microsoft.com/) to install a package from our pre-production (INT) environment which tests connectivity:


```
mkdir cdn-test
cd cdn-test
dotnet new classlib
dotnet add package BaseTestPackage.NetStandard --source https://apiint.nugettest.org/v3/index.json
```

If you are experiencing connectivity issues while connecting to nuget.org or restoring packages from https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json, such as:

"The SSL connection could not be established"

Please ensure that TLS 1.2 and any of the following cipher suites have been enabled on your machine:

TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256

If you have any questions, do reach out to us at support@nuget.org or by commenting on the discussion issue: NuGet/Home#11058
